title: Assessing Radiation Pressure as a Feedback Mechanism in Star-forming Galaxies
excerpt: Radiation pressure from the absorption and scattering of starlight by dust grains, which are hydrodynamically coupled to the gas, sets a hard upper limit to the luminosity of star-forming regions.
citation: Andrews, B. H. & Thompson, T. A. 2011, ApJ, 727, 97.

title: Principal Component Abundance Analysis of Microlensed Bulge Dwarf and Subgiant Stars
excerpt: PCA of elemental abundances of bulge stars revealing that the first two components are (1) correlated alpha elements and (2) correlated Na and Ni---two elements that have metallicity-dependent core-collapse supernova yields.
citation: Andrews, B. H., et al. 2012, AcA, 62, 269.

title: The Mass-Metallicity Relation with the Direct Method on Stacked Spectra of SDSS Galaxies
excerpt: The direct method mass-metallicity relation has a steeper slope, a lower turnover mass, and a factor of 2-3 greater dependence on SFR than strong line mass-metallicity relations.
citation: Andrews, B. H. & Martini, P. 2013, ApJ, 765, 140.

title: A Recalibration of Strong-line Oxygen Abundance Diagnostics via the Direct Method and Implications for the High-redshift Universe
excerpt: We use direct method metallicities of stacked SDSS galaxies to recalibrate strong line metallicity diagnostics.
citation: Brown, J. S., Martini, P., & Andrews, B. H. 2016, MNRAS, 458, 1529.

title: Inflow, Outflow, Yields, and Stellar Population Mixing in Chemical Evolution Models
excerpt: We explore the trade-offs in parameters of chemical evolution models.
citation: Andrews, B. H., et al. 2017, ApJ, 835, 224.

title: Equilibrium and Sudden Events in Chemical Evolution
excerpt: We construct an analytic chemical evolution model with a realistic SNIa delay time distribution to probe how model parameters affect equilibrium abundances and the effects of sudden changes to those parameters.
citation: Weinberg, D. H., Andrews, B. H., & Freudenburg, J. 2017, ApJ, 837, 183.

title: Marvin: A Tool Kit for Streamlined Access and Visualization of the SDSS-IV MaNGA Data Set
excerpt: We develop a data access, exploration, analysis, and visualization toolkit for the SDSS-IV MaNGA survey that seamlessly transitions between locally and remotely-stored data.
citation: Cherinka, B., Andrews, B. H., Sanchez-Gallego, J., et al. 2019, AJ, 158, 74.

title: Machine-learning Classifiers for Intermediate Redshift Emission-line Galaxies
excerpt: We use several machine learning algorithms to classify intermediate redshift emission line galaxies using only properties in optical spectra and ugriz photometry.
citation: Zhang, K., Schlegal, D. J., Andrews, B. H., et al. 2019, ApJ, 883, 63.

title: Milky Way Analogues in MaNGA: Multi-Parameter Homogeneity and Comparison to the Milky Way
excerpt: MaNGA Milky Way Analogs consistently have younger stellar populations at large radii but a wide range of central stellar population ages; about half of the MWAs have central AGN or composite activity.
citation: Boardman, N., Zasowski, G., Seth, A., Newman, J., Andrews, B. H., et al. 2019, MNRAS, tmp-2734.  boardman2019
